website_summaries.verdict: This bandsaw is a great tool for smaller projects at a bargain price. Consider this if you don't anticipate many heavy-duty projects.
pros: Packs plenty of power for smaller projects
Light, fence, and miter gauge are included
Nice, solid enough tool for most hobbyists
cons: Not appropriate for high volume work or mowing through a bunch of hardwood
Generally not as heavy-duty or durable as other models we considered

customer_reviews.title: NIce tool for the price.
customer_reviews.text: As one reviewer has written this was purchased to make scales (handles) for straight razors and other small projects. I've worked around power equipment all my life and fully understand the machines limitations. The fellow who rated this machine as having only enough power to cut hot butter must have either A. Gotten a poor example of the machine or B. Didn't set it up right. After properly adjusting the machine I used it with the blade that was included to cut a piece of 1" thick Black Walnut/both against and with the grain to make an extension for the miter gauge. While I took it slow, the saw worked perfectly. Here's some pics;
customer_reviews.author: RAD

customer_reviews.title: This has to be the worst tool I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the worst tool I have ever owned...blade adjustment is impossible and it doesn't cut anything thicker than 1/2 in thick. Also, when it does cut, the motor bogs down till u stop moving piece of wood and then begin again or the blade will just stop if u don't pull wood back....sooo slow to cut anything. I have tried other reputable blades and that is such a chore getting that blade centered on the wheels. I gave all I had to get that blade adjustment right and it keeps popping off the wheels. Original blade broke after cutting a couple pieces of wood. Worse thing is - I cant return it!
customer_reviews.author: Design Kat

customer_reviews.title: looks good to start
customer_reviews.text: looks good to start. well packaged and ok instructions. However... blade guides are very poor in design. I have years of experience and thought I could make this little guy work for me. During adjustment a part of the case that holds the lower blade guide broke off. Result is a piece of junk! I may be able to jerry-rig some fix, but not confident right now. At my best adjustment I could not get the saw to cut a straight line! Do not buy this product. Save your money and buy a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Brunner

customer_reviews.title: Also tested it on some 2x4 scrap I had laying around and it worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: After getting it set up and adjusted, it cut through the soft pine of a pinewood derby car with no problem. Also tested it on some 2x4 scrap I had laying around and it worked like a charm. The table was solid when adjusted to an angle and the fence stays securely in place. The fence is adjustable on both sides, so it does need to be adjusted to square manually, however with rulers on both sides of the table, that was an easy task to accomplish. This bandsaw is great for the small projects I have around the house and look forward to using it more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Valyrian

customer_reviews.title: Low availability for replacement parts
customer_reviews.text: This saw performs well for a home use saw that isn't needed for heavy duty cutting. The wheel tire, which is a piece of rubber that goes between the blade and the wheel, broke about a year after purchase. I'm not upset that it broke as this is a consumeable item. However, Skill has a two month back order on replacements. This is further complicated because this saw doesn't use industry standard wheel tires. This experience is the complete opposite of what I have experienced with WEN, a competitor on Amazon with similar products. Their customer service is very helpful. Further, I've needed several parts for a WEN product and they have always been in stock.
customer_reviews.author: PH

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money at all
customer_reviews.text: update - this thing is a piece of cheap S***. Upper wheel doesn’t adjust as advertised, in fact, it doesn’t move up/down at all and I’m unable to tighten the bandsaw blade - which doesn’t let me cut anything because it just pops off. Piece of S***
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Great saw and features for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Solid saw with good features. The rip fence and miter guide are a definite bonus. To this point, I have cut multiple pen blanks, as well as some smaller (1.5" max thickness) boards. The cut isn't perfectly smooth, so it likely needs further refinement, but it's good enough for my purposes. Adjustments are easy, if a bit tedious. Nothing out of the ordinary for a band saw. I've pushed some rather hard woods through here already. I definitely recommend connecting the dust port to a vacuum. Otherwise you'll spend 10x longer cleaning the saw than using it. This saw has taken the place of my Rockwell BladeRunner as my convenient saw for small objects.
customer_reviews.author: EEToolman

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Horrible band saw. It will NOT cut in a straight line. I have made numerous, numerous adjustments, and to constantly drifts almost 45 degrees to the right. Returned and will try another brand. I don't need to use a bandsaw often, but when I do use one I need it to be at least somewhat accurate, which this is NOT.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: It's alright for the 140 I spent
customer_reviews.text: So the pros: It was cheap, it's light, so it can be moved around (though I bolted it down to my bench). It's great for basic cuts with small pieces of lumber. And the cons: It's cheap, I have a lot of blade drift when making cuts, it does not have adjustable speed, the angle markers don't seem to be 100% accurate. Trying to do rips or cut larger pieces are a no-go. I've stopped the blade trying to cut through a 2x4 on the short side. If you want something basic for nothing more than an inch or so, this will work perfectly, but if you're attempting to build furniture, spring for a better model.
customer_reviews.author: FreezingToad

customer_reviews.title: The Easy-Bake oven of bench top band saws
customer_reviews.text: Without comparing it to my 14" delta, the overall construction and quality could pass for a toy (without the motor and blade of course), sort of the Easy-Bake oven of bench top band saws. I bought it going off reviews, but I'm thinking there has to be some out there that are better made. Even though I've adjusted the blade tension recently making then changes, it still wobbles and looks like I sawed it with a dull steak knife! Like I said, without comparing it to my delta, I don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Richele R

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, very fragile, out of square.
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received had a warped table. Can't make precise cuts with a saw that isn't square so I sent it back. On the second one, the Cast metal housing was cracked even though it was well packed in foam. I'm not going to try a third time. I wish there were another brand that hit the sweet spot the specs on this saw does: Low weight, work light, included fence, a low price. On a side note, I contacted Skil for a replacement for the warped table and was told to send the whole saw back for a replacement. Thank you amazon for your excellent return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Daugherty

customer_reviews.title: Toy
customer_reviews.text: I would have to rate this as more of a toy than even a "hobbiest" bandsaw. If you want to cut 1/4 - 1/8" wood, it will do just fine. Even with a new blade, it struggles with 3/4" hardwood and won't even consider 1 1/2". You cannot adjust the blade not to drift (which can be done on all 'real' bandsaws despite some opinions to the contrary) so the fence is worthless. I would NOT buy it again or recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Mark T. Parker

customer_reviews.title: I've had this saw for about 3 hours, and I love it!
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this thing is great! I purchased this inexpensively for my shop to use for cutting aluminum and mild steel. Thus far, I've got a few hours on it and seem to have it dialed in. This saw is great for the money. Pair it with the Bosch BS5912-18M blade and you're ready to trim some metal. I'll revise this review if I find any shortcomings.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D.

customer_reviews.title: A nice hobby saw
customer_reviews.text: A nice little hobby saw. Just wish it was able to cut a max height 4 inches. Yes, I do realize it was says 3 1/2 in the description but was wishful that it was underestimating. The light is a great feature and make sure you spend the time to setup the blade (tension/alignment). If not you will have crooked cuts and it will seem like the blade isn't really cutting smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: A solid buy for medium use home woodworking
customer_reviews.text: I do just enough home and “stuff” repair to justify buying this. It’s a far safer and more accurate option than clamping the wood in a vice and using a jig saw by hand. Very simple to open up. I would recommend reading some of the other reviews here for ideas on how to tinker with it, but so far I haven’t needed to at all. The light is an eye-saver, for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Portia74

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I have the hardest time with the blade lining up
customer_reviews.author: David Pickrell

customer_reviews.title: Cannot cut a straight line
customer_reviews.text: No matter what I do, this saw will not do anything but cut a jagged, hard to finish line. It doesn't matter what blade I use, or how I adjust the tension. This is nothing more than a toy. It's maximum depth is too short to handle much of what I want to do - for instance, I often want to make legs from 4x4 stock, and this can't handle that. There is no possible way you could re-saw wood with this, you'd get a more accurate cute with a chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Ernst Schoen-rene

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Little Band Saw!
customer_reviews.text: What a great little saw for home projects! Wife had some crafting projects she wanted cut out of 3/4" Pine , worked great with included blade! I took some time to set up the blade guides properly when I took it out of the box before operating. This is a must do as they are not set up from factory even though the blade is installed. Instructions are in the included manual. Runs smooth with little vibration. Light could be better but I have shop lights to use. Nice for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: This is one step up from a toy, but for the price that's kind of what I expected. Took a couple hours to make the adjustments, which is nothing special to this bandsaw. However try as I might there is still a decent amount of vibration. I bought this model for the extras (light, fence, miter gauge)- vibrates so bad the light doesnt stay in place, the miter is crap and the fence is only a step away from being useless. I almost feel like i would have been better off with a scroll saw...
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas W.

customer_reviews.title: Surprising value for money
customer_reviews.text: In all honesty i was surprised. I let my Full size craftsman go when i moved to a smaller place a few years ago. Had need for a saw and bought this one. Does it do what the fullsize saw did, no, but cut through a 2 inch oak board easily (throw the included blade away and get a decent blade). If you take your time and use a decent blade it will handle smaller projects. If you want to cut heavy stuff get a heavy duty saw!
customer_reviews.author: Gerry

customer_reviews.title: This is a piece of trash- DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box one of the wheel tires was broken. $25 replacement part for something that costs $125. Can't say how this saw performs yet. Very cheaply made saw. It will be fine for light duty things. Update: I just threw this thing in the trash can. It is unsuited for any work whatsoever- blade flies off with any force- and yes I have it adjusted correctly. Throwing in the trash because I wouldn't dare give this thing to someone. SKIL should be ashamed of this product. My how far SKIL has fallen.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A Brupbacher

customer_reviews.title: Crapolla!
customer_reviews.text: Junk! Motor overheats, under powered, doesn't cut straight. Ruined a bunch of wood trying to get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Emy

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase for the cost
customer_reviews.text: Received the band saw in good condition. It was easy to set up and works well. The blade it comes with is ok for light wood projects. For heavier items, a blade with a higher tooth count per inch would be better. If you plan to use this for light to medium wood projects, it works very well. For heavier items or metal it takes a while to get through the material.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight

customer_reviews.title: Works, but definitely NOT a commercial quality band saw.
customer_reviews.text: Product works for small home projects. This is not a commercial grade saw. As such the blade tends to wander a bit, which is a bit difficult to overcome. If I had need of a band saw more often, I would buy a better one. No more often than I use one, this one suffices. My old one died because the rubber tires on the belt wheels cracked and separated rendering the old one useless.
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: Much better than a scroll saw
customer_reviews.text: I'm just a hobbyist and home owner, but this is so much more worth it than the WEN scroll saw that I replaced with this. You need to make sure you learn how to adjust everything properly but once everything is buttoned down, it works fantastically. I'm almost thinking I don't need my table saw anymore too. I guess the only thing this couldn't do is cut a large sheet of playwood in half, but 2x4s, no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Schrum

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality and Quiet Band Saw
customer_reviews.text: Excellent SKIL Band Saw. This was my first ever purchase of a band saw. I made the right choice. Not only was it affordable but also high quality. After reading the well written manual and attaching the base and checking all the alignments, I turned it on and it worked perfectly. It was also very quiet, to my surprise. It can be used during the day or during the night without disturbing the neighbors. It cut perfectly through some 1/4 inch hardwood that I use in my hobby projects. This is perfect for my wood project. I am very happy with this SKIL Band Saw.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D Mowery

customer_reviews.title: This product seems as if it came from a old lot of auction bidded parts.
customer_reviews.text: It cannot cut straight, and the lower cast aluminum wheel, which has a rubber pad around it for the blades grip/drive, is all cracked and hard. Like the rubber was a bad batch. Steer clear!
customer_reviews.author: Rufus

customer_reviews.title: Good band saw for DIYer
customer_reviews.text: I have had this band saw for a while. It was easy to put together and I really like the light accessory that illuminates the field of cutting. The saw blade was easy to install and I had it up and running in 15 minutes. It come well packaged. I have found the power to be adequate for my needs as I am not resawing large boards but using it for cutting wood around 1-2 inches thick. I am glad that I had a chance to review this product and would recommend it for the average DIYer.
customer_reviews.author: Bud J.

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong over 2 years later
customer_reviews.text: I"ve been using this item over 2 years now and it's still going strong. Such a time saver. It's not that great for resawing, but as a supplement to scroll-sawing, I use it for all my straight cuts and it saves me a lot of time (and scroll saw blades). Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan May

customer_reviews.title: its been great so far
customer_reviews.text: its been great so far. for the price i am very surprised. i use it for wood pens and 2X4 cuts for small projects. make sure the belt is tight on the motor and it will have the power. cons: the led light is not that bright almost kinda useless. The reason i took off a star is the Miter gauge Groove in the table is Not stander. so if you want to make your own sled you are out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: T. Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted, but DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these a few years back, and it was great while it lasted. The tires that transport the actual saw (part number 1619PA2626 ) has been discontinued. If they go out on you, you're screwed and you'll have to buy a new saw. The aftermarket tires don't have the groove in them to match the wheel and make it dangerously unstable. DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pixelslinger

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE: good saw for the price point.
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to even use as I cannot get get the blade to stay on...! I'll update my review IF / WHEN I can get the blade to stay on and I can actually use the saw. Otherwise it's going back today! Is the upper tracking wheel supposed to be 'wobbly' if feels as if there should be a spring or some tension when using the outer adjustment knob...!? UPDATE: got the blade tracking set - bit of a learning curve, but good now. It's been working fine. I'd recommend for this price point.
customer_reviews.author: William O.

customer_reviews.title: So happy to have this
customer_reviews.text: The seller worked with me and the product arrived perfectly. So happy to have this. The Rip-Fence works perfectly and it is so easy to install different blades. Some bandsaws in this price range don't include the rip fence and have no rulers built in so this product for the price really takes the cake.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen8454

customer_reviews.title: SELF DESTRUCTS
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for three years until I noticed pieces of the black rubber/plastic covering between the blade and metal wheels had disintegrated. It's a pretty important component because the blade rides on it and the machine cannot be operated without it. The whole unit is pretty flimsy as the company has cut cost every which way with subpar materials, but why use a rubber/plastic compound for such a critical part that falls apart when exposed to the air??
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Price appropriate for quality
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised. Its plastic so dont expect a solid professional grade machine. The blade slips off often but that may just be my learning curve. It can do the basic work of a band saw. It works fine for my purposes and I would recommend it to other hobbyists but not to pros.
customer_reviews.author: Dean J Copely

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Skil bandsaw. The first one the plastic bearings wore out, the 'tires' were cracked and worn. It was cheaper in the long run to buy a new one than buy replacement parts. I have kept the old one for other good parts to use. The new saw has metal bearings now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its o.k.
customer_reviews.text: Go very slow even when using the fence as the blade has a tendency to twist. You must lower so that the blade guide is just a little above your work piece. My blade is just tight enough but you need to take your time if you want a straight cut on your piece.
customer_reviews.author: The Shark

customer_reviews.title: great band saw forthe price
customer_reviews.text: band saw works well, cuts great and no kick back , 2 things I wished is the table would rise up and down depending on the thickness of the wood, and wish the groove for the slide rule was closer to the blade to cut angles, other than that a great saw
customer_reviews.author: jeff t.

customer_reviews.title: Great for small scale jobs.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw to make miniature houses. It works fine for this purpose. I would not use it to rip 2x4s or large projects. I think anything over a half inch would induce too large a load for it's two amp motor. I gave it five stars because it works great on small scale jobs, scale meaning dollhouses and such.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Skill 9" band saw is excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: The Skill 9" band saw was better than I had expected. Everything worked smoothly, and the tool was tuned up, surprise. The table was square with the blade, and the blade tracked perfectly on the wheels. Vibration was minimal. I changed the blade to a finer one, and it cut aluminum parts like butter. Highly recommended band saw for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Can’t Complain
customer_reviews.text: I can’t relate to any of the negative reviews for this bandsaw. I’ve used it nonstop for the past few months and have had zero issues. I’ve cut figures and shapes out of multiple hardwood species. I’ve even been able to split 3 inch tall 1 1/2 inch thick walnut boards in half with no problem. Can’t speak for a commercial/industrial woodworker, but for a hobbyist, this is a great saw!
customer_reviews.author: michael rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Nearly PERFECT, inexpensive band saw for the beginner woodworker.
customer_reviews.text: Nearly PERFECT, inexpensive band saw for the beginner woodworker. I'm a beginner, and this should suit my needs perfectly, at least until I feel the need for a more professional grade saw.. It has several desirable features in a "starter" band saw. Although it's NOT professional grade, it should fulfill my needs for a significant time. I'm very pleased with my purchase. It arrived on time and in appropriate packaging, undamaged. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Climer

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup and a great Saw
customer_reviews.text: I am truly surprised how great this saw actually turned out to be. Fantastic product.
customer_reviews.author: MrCritic4real

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Adjust the saw according to the directions and it works great. You cannot force it, so go at a normal pace. I am very pleased with it as a woodcarver. No more buying wood. I walk in the woods, get me a dead tree and go to work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I had to make some adjustments to the pulleys and bearing. I noticed the band might have come off had I used it without checking first. Band isn’t great. Leave some room for sanding smooth when you make your cuts, or spend $500 on a good one.
customer_reviews.author: E.J. Zayas

customer_reviews.title: Now i must invest in a' real' bandsaw
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what happened. The Skil saw I have is pretty solid, but this bandsaw is pretty terrible. It's just too light and flimsy. It vibrates so much that it kills my precision i would've had. cheap bandsaws shouldn't exist.
customer_reviews.author: Cell

customer_reviews.title: I cut 4- 2 X 8 boards easily. I would recommend this saw for home use
customer_reviews.text: Bandsaw was delivered today. It took about 20 minutes to put together and test run. There was no problems with saw blade running off pulley. The only adjustment that I made was to tighten the tension. I cut 4- 2 X 8 boards easily. I would recommend this saw for home use.
customer_reviews.author: Boomer

customer_reviews.title: Works well for wood working
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my hubby for Christmas because he has been doing a lot of wood projects out in the garage lately. He says it works perfect and he loves it. He uses it primarily for cutting wood and making wood toys and stools and things like that. I got a nice new wooden garbage can out of it so I'm happy. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Primo Bear

customer_reviews.title: Works great, very good for small projects Work light is ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, very good for small projects Work light is a nice addition wheels run true and very little vibration Spend the time to do a proper set up and you will have no problem. Part of a proper set up is to replace the saw blade with after market blade for less than 10 dollars.. Mount saw on a free standing Harbor Frieght tool stand and you are G.T.G.
customer_reviews.author: Joe lunch box

customer_reviews.title: Good hobby saw
customer_reviews.text: Good for intended use of small, detailed work. Cutting wood over 1 inch can be very slow. But I would not buy again because of how weak the motor is.
customer_reviews.author: scwman

customer_reviews.title: Underpowered for most projects - not versatile enough.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bandsaw to cut curves for some Adirondack chairs. I’m using 3/4” cypress. I’ve been able to use it, but it’s definitely underpowered. The blade stops frequently through the cuts. The blade also frequently slips off the drive wheels. This is my first bandsaw so I could be doing something wrong. I also tried cutting through a 3” thick section of cypress, and the motor completely cut out. I can’t imagine using it for all but the thinnest pieces of hardwood.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Schenkelberg

customer_reviews.title: Nice piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.text: I certainly got more than my money’s worth with this saw. I wasn’t expecting much but after I set it up by watching some videos, it is fantastic. The accuracy is now much better than what it was right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: TomKat

customer_reviews.title: Neat little saw for home use
customer_reviews.text: Quickly delivered, and was as described. I attached it to a light tool stand, and have been happily cutting away, ever since. For the occasional small project, home hobbyist this is a lot of bang for the buck. The included miter and fence are nice touches, too.
customer_reviews.author: Dana  A Kopher

customer_reviews.title: A good deal for the price
customer_reviews.text: Band saw was just like new. I build wooden toys to give away to local charities to hand out to young children. The saw cuts well and follows easy curves without binding. I only use 1-1/2 inch or thinner fir or pine for my toys, so I am not sure if the saw has the power to go through oak or thicker wood. But for a hobby saw, it works fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Oglethorpe

customer_reviews.title: A good find!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small and portable band saw for a small work area and this fits the bill wonderfully! Easy to pick up and move yet heavy enough to topple or bump over. The blade that comes with is a course wood bit so if you're planning to cut metal be sure to order a blade to replace the one that comes with. Nicely designed and works very well for my small projects,
customer_reviews.author: L. Lorden

customer_reviews.title: Very cool tool for the money
customer_reviews.text: Don't know why people are so critical of this unit. This a low cost awesome little band saw that has helped me tremendously. Yes the fence is a pain but for the cost and a little technique, it works just fine. Good power and the light is very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: pudgecake

customer_reviews.title: This is a great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install because it comes all put together ready to operate. Can't get an easier. And on yes did say, it also is fully set up, adjusted to use. Now that is a great purchase as a very good price for home or small shop use.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Gingrich

customer_reviews.title: ... below the table are far from precise and too easy to move out of place accidentally
customer_reviews.text: It does the job but the blade guides that you so carefully calibrate above and below the table are far from precise and too easy to move out of place accidentally.
customer_reviews.author: Senor_Kasper

customer_reviews.title: Runs hot very quickly
customer_reviews.text: Cheap product is not built well at all will never buy one of these again runs hot very quickly
customer_reviews.author: Nyrangers03

customer_reviews.title: Good tool with minor exceptions
customer_reviews.text: I was overall pleased with the band saw. I have used it for two home projects so far. The advantages are the portability and cost. The disadvantages are that the blade, even with tension adjustments, does slip off the wheels too frequently and the interior of housing fills rapidly with sawdust.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Built-in safety features and ability to attach vacuum hose for dust collection are great features. The first use was by a family
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly. Built-in safety features and ability to attach vacuum hose for dust collection are great features. The first use was by a family member who cut two types of very hard wood into thin sheets from blocks to use for large knife handles; the saw cut these with ease. Very sastisfied with the performance of this saw.
customer_reviews.author: M. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about 2 weeks, now doesn’t cut straight at all. Tried to make adjuvants , took apart and repositioned the blade and still no luck. It’s worthless now.
customer_reviews.author: M. T

customer_reviews.title: Issues help?
customer_reviews.text: Anyone had issues with this Bandsaw’s wheels being crooked? After hours of fine tuning, the blade still drifts on the wheel & doesnt cut straight..
customer_reviews.author: Greg Gabonay

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like a champ
customer_reviews.text: Do your kids need there hot dogs cut up or grilled cheese in triangles this is the perfect kitchen appliance for you also looks striking out on the counter lots of comments from the house guests
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great band saw
customer_reviews.text: Great little band saw for the home hobbiest. It was ready to go out of the box. I did have to adjust the blade guide so it wasn’t rubbing the blade but that was common and easy
customer_reviews.author: Key_Yak_J

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly and in good shape. Husband put it together and tried it out to make sure it worked. He hasn't used it to build anything yet.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara M.

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: STARTED OUT " OK " THEN JUST GOT WORSE, WILL NOT CUT A STRAIGHT LINE FOR NUTHIN' , TRIED 4 KINDS OF BLADES MADE EVERY ADJUSTMENT POSSIBLE, USED THE RIP FENCE , TRIED EVERYTHING I CAN THINK OF, JUST A POS I GUESS, I WOULD RETURN IT BUT I THINK IT'S TOO LATE. TO THE DUMP IT GOES.
customer_reviews.author: Garry

customer_reviews.title: Great starter band saw
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this purchase. The saw is great for a starter like myself. I did alot of research before buying it. Everything was great was able to set it up in just a little time and started to make some cuts.

customer_reviews.title: It handles cutting wood fine (I've used pine
customer_reviews.text: It handles cutting wood fine (I've used pine, oak and mahogany) although it seems to cut very rough. The specs for the blade guides state that they should be .020", I've narrowed it to .016" hoping that would clean up the cut but it is still very rough. I have to clean up the cuts with my belt sander, I have not used a band saw before but I wouldn't think the cut should be so bad. Not sure if the blade I got with it is bad or if one of the wheels is out of round. I will buy a new finer tooth blade and see what happens. Anybody else have this issue?

product_meta.title: SKIL 3386-01 120-Volt 9-Inch Band Saw with Light
product_meta.description: For cutting irregular shapes and ripping lumber into thinner pieces, novice woodworkers will find the 3386 SKIL 9-inch Band Saw with Light is essential for their workshop. You'll cut through a variety of wood materials with the 6-TPI blade. Make quick angle and height changes with the rack and pinion adjustable table. EZ View Blade Tracking lets you easily align the blade. Other features include a rip fence for straight cuts and a miter gauge for cross cuts. The dust port keeps your work area dust-free, while the LED work light adjusts so that you can see exactly what you're doing.
feature_bullets: Rip fence for straight, accurate cuts; 6 TPI band saw blade cuts through a variety of wood materials
Articulating LED work light for better view of work piece and cut line
Features a 1-1/2 inch dust port that keeps work area clear of dust
Rack and pinion table adjustment for quick angle and height adjustments
Motor is 1 speed for wood or metal based materials
